Runaway_June:
{{Short description|American country music group}} {{redirect|Jennifer Wayne|the British children's author|Jenifer Wayne}} {{for|the biomedical engineer|Jennifer S Wayne}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Runaway June | image = File:Runaway June.jpg | image_size = 280px | landscape = | alt = | caption = Runaway June performing at Jugfest in June 2017 | alias = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2015–present | label = * Quartz Hill * [[Broken Bow Records|Wheelhouse]] | spinoff_of = {{hlist|[[Stealing Angels]]|[[Natalie Stovall and the Drive]]}} | current_members = {{hlist|Jennifer Wayne|Natalie Stovall|Stevie Woodward}} | past_members = {{hlist|Hannah Mulholland|Naomi Cooke}} | website = {{URL|www.runawayjune.com}} }} '''Runaway June''' is an American [[country music]] group consisting of Stevie Woodward (lead vocals, guitar, piano, harmonica, autoharp), Jennifer Wayne (guitar, vocals), and Natalie Stovall (guitar, fiddle, banjo, mandolin, vocals). Wayne co-founded the group in 2015 with Hannah Mulholland (mandolin, vocals) and Naomi Cooke (lead vocals). Wayne was a former member of [[Stealing Angels]] and had co-written singles for other singers prior to the group's foundation. Signed to [[BBR Music Group]]'s Wheelhouse imprint in 2015, the group charted two singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts prior to their breakthrough hit "[[Buy My Own Drinks]]" in 2018. This was the first of three singles from their 2019 studio album ''[[Blue Roses (Runaway June album)|Blue Roses]]''. Mulholland quit the group in 2020 and was replaced by Natalie Stovall, former lead singer of [[Natalie Stovall and the Drive]]; Cooke quit in 2022 and was replaced by Stevie Woodward. ==Background== [[File:Runaway June performing at Camp Schwab Festival.jpg|thumb|Runaway June performing at the [[Camp Schwab]] Festival in March 2023]] Jennifer Wayne, a granddaughter of [[John Wayne]], grew up in southern California, and Hannah Mulholland grew up in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], while Naomi Cooke is from Cedar Key, Florida. Cooke co-wrote [[Tyler Farr]]'s top 40 hit "[[Better in Boots]]". Wayne was originally one-third of the group [[Stealing Angels]], and co-wrote [[Eric Paslay]]'s top 20 hit "[[She Don't Love You]]" and [[Keith Urban]]'s 2021 hit "[[Wild Hearts (song)|Wild Hearts]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2016/06/06/whos-new-runaway-june/|title=Who's New: Runaway June|date=June 6, 2016|work=Nash Country Daily|accessdate=September 9, 2016}} Under this lineup, Cooke was the lead vocalist, Mulholland was the low harmony vocalist and [[mandolin]] player,{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7494615/runaway-june-cowboys-classic-interview|title=Country Trio Runaway June Talks Football Fandom, Family Ties to John Wayne & Those Inevitable Dixie Chicks Comparisons|last=Dauphin|first=Chuck|date=August 30, 2016|magazine=Billboard|accessdate=September 9, 2016}} and Wayne the high harmony vocalist and guitar player. The three met in Nashville and wrote their debut single "Lipstick" with assistance from [[Rebecca Lynn Howard]], Caroline Hobby (also a former member of Stealing Angels), and Elisha Hoffman. The song was released in 2016 via [[Broken Bow Records]]' Wheelhouse Records imprint. An uncredited review from ''[[Taste of Country]]'' praised the "original premise" and vocal harmonies.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/runaway-june-lipstick/|title=Runaway June - 'Lipstick'|last=Dukes|first=Billy|date=May 20, 2016|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=September 9, 2016}} They released their self-titled debut [[Extended play|EP]] in September 2018,{{cite web |last1=Despres |first1=Tricia |title=Runaway June Announces Plans for Their Self-Titled Debut EP |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/runaway-june-self-titled-debut-ep/ |website=Taste of Country |date=23 August 2018 |accessdate=17 December 2018 |language=en}} which featured the singles "Wild West" and "[[Buy My Own Drinks]]".{{cite web |url=https://www.onecountry.com/country-artists/runaway-june-single-buy-my-own-drinks/ |title=[Listen] Runaway June's Catchy New Single "Buy My Own Drinks" Will Leave You Feeling Empowered |first=Lisa |last=Konicki|date=June 29, 2018 |work=One Country}} The group was a supporting act for [[Carrie Underwood]] on her [[The Cry Pretty Tour 360|Cry Pretty Tour 360]], which ran from May 1, 2019, to October 31, 2019, alongside [[Maddie & Tae]].{{cite magazine |last1=Kaufman |first1=Gil |title=Carrie Underwood Announces The Cry Pretty Tour 360 With All-Female Bill: See the Dates |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8469238/carrie-underwood-announces-tour-dates-2019 |magazine=Billboard |accessdate=17 December 2018}} On May 23, 2019, the group announced their debut album ''[[Blue Roses (Runaway June album)|Blue Roses]]'', which was released on June 28, 2019.{{cite web |last1=Krol |first1=Jacklyn |title=Runaway June Announce Sophomore Album, 'Blue Roses' |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/runaway-june-blue-roses-album-2019/ |website=Taste of Country |date=23 May 2019 |accessdate=31 May 2019 |language=en}} "[[Buy My Own Drinks]]" which served as the lead-off single, is included on the album alongside three other songs from their previous EP release.{{cite web |last1=Casey |first1=Jim |title=Runaway June Announces Release of Debut Album, "Blue Roses" |url=http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2019/05/31/runaway-june-announces-release-of-debut-album-blue-roses/ |website=Nash Country Daily |date=31 May 2019 |accessdate=3 June 2019 |language=en}} The album debuted at No. 36 on the Top Country Albums chart,{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/country-albums/2019-07-13 |title=Top Country Albums |date=July 13, 2019 |magazine=Billboard }} and No. 2 on the Heatseekers Albums chart.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/heatseekers-albums/2019-07-13 |title=Heatseekers Albums |date=July 13, 2019 |magazine=Billboard }} After "Buy My Own Drinks", the band also charted two more singles from the album: "Head over Heels" and "We Were Rich". On May 14, 2020, Mulholland announced that she was leaving the group.{{cite web|url=https://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2020/05/14/hannah-mulholland-departs-runaway-june-it-is-bittersweet-but-i-am-excited-to-continue-to-evolve-grow/|title=Hannah Mulholland Departs Runaway June: "It Is Bittersweet, But I Am Excited to Continue to Evolve & Grow"|author=Jim Casey|date=May 14, 2020|publisher=Nash Country Daily|accessdate=May 14, 2020}} The next day, the other two members confirmed that she was replaced by Natalie Stovall, former lead singer of [[Natalie Stovall and the Drive]], who also plays the [[fiddle]] for the group.{{cite web |author=Stefano |first=Angela |date=May 15, 2020 |title=Natalie Stovall Joins Runaway June to Replace Hannah Mulholland |url=https://tasteofcountry.com/natalie-stovall-joins-runaway-june/ |accessdate=May 15, 2020 |publisher=Taste of Country}} This was followed in February 2022 by Naomi Cooke's departure from the band; she was replaced by Stevie Woodward two months later.{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2022/04/stevie-woodward-joins-runaway-june-as-lead-singer/ | title=Stevie Woodward Joins Runaway June As Lead Singer | publisher=Music Row | date=April 7, 2022 | accessdate=April 7, 2022}} In 2023, Runaway June signed with Quartz Hill Records and released "Make Me Wanna Smoke" as their first single under the new label.{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2023/05/runaway-june-signs-with-quartz-hill-records-brown-sellers-brown-management/ | title=Runaway June Signs with Quartz Hill Records & Brown Sellers Brown Management | date=10 May 2023 }} ==Personal lives== On January 9, 2021, Wayne married Austin Moody in a private ceremony.{{cite web |author=Black |first=Lauren Jo |date=January 10, 2021 |title=Jennifer Wayne Marries Austin Moody in Intimate Beach Wedding |url=https://countrynow.com/runaway-junes-jennifer-wayne-marries-austin-moody-in-intimate-beach-wedding/ |accessdate=Jan 25, 2022 |publisher=Country Now}} She first confirmed in November 2021 that she was pregnant with her first child.{{cite web |author=VanHoose |first=Benjamin |date=Nov 5, 2021 |title=Jennifer Wayne Pregnant With First Baby |url=https://people.com/parents/runaway-june-jennifer-wayne-pregnant-expecting-first-baby-daughter/ |accessdate=Nov 5, 2021 |publisher=People}} Lily Maria Moody was born on April 18, 2022.{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/runaway-june-jennifer-wayne-baby-girl/|title=Jennifer Wayne welcomes Baby Girl|date=April 22, 2022}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |+ List of albums, with selected chart positions, showing year released and album name ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:15em;"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="3"| Peak chart
